summary: The Safety Grant Consistency Act, introduced in the Senate, aims to limit the Secretary of Transportation's ability to impose new requirements on highway safety grant programs. The bill prohibits the Secretary from establishing new performance measures or regulatory/program requirements not in effect before the bill's enactment and mandates the easing or elimination of existing requirements not explicitly mandated by Congress, relating to programs under sections 402 and 405 of title 23, United States Code.
